me.desht.sensibletoolbox.blocks

Class BaseSTBBlock

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.desht.sensibletoolbox.items.BaseSTBItem
      • me.desht.sensibletoolbox.blocks.BaseSTBBlock
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Comparable<STBItem>, STBBlock, STBItem, InventoryGUI.InventoryGUIListener, STBFreezable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AngelicBlock, BaseSTBMachine, BlockUpdateDetector, Elevator, EnderBox, Floodlight, ItemRouter, PaintCan, RedstoneClock, SoundMuffler, TrashCan

    public abstract class BaseSTBBlock
extends BaseSTBItem
implements STBBlock

        Description copied from interface: STBBlock
        Get the direction that this block faces. Note that the block may not necessarily have any visual representation of a facing direction. A block's facing direction is determined by the direction that the player who placed was facing at the time.

      • hasAccessRights

        public final boolean hasAccessRights(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
        Description copied from interface: STBBlock
        Check if this block may be interacted with by the given player, based on its current security settings, and the player's permissions. If the player has the permission node "stb.access.any" then this method will always return true.
        Specified by:
        hasAccessRights in interface STBBlock
        Parameters:
        player - the player to check
        Returns:
        true if the block may be accessed

      • hasAccessRights

        public final boolean hasAccessRights(UUID uuid)
        Description copied from interface: STBBlock
        Check if this block may be interacted with by the player of the given UUID, based on its current security settings. Note that no player permission check is done here.
        Specified by:
        hasAccessRights in interface STBBlock
        Parameters:
        uuid - the UUID to check
        Returns:
        true if the block may be accessed

      • onBlockDamage

        public void onBlockDamage(org.bukkit.event.block.BlockDamageEvent event)
        Called when an STB block receives a damage event. The default behaviour is to ignore the event.
        Parameters:
        event - the block damage event

      • onBlockPhysics

        public void onBlockPhysics(org.bukkit.event.block.BlockPhysicsEvent event)
        Called when an STB block receives a physics event. The default behaviour is to ignore the event.
        Parameters:
        event - the block physics event

      • onInteractBlock

        public void onInteractBlock(org.bukkit.event.player.PlayerInteractEvent event)
        Called when an STB block is interacted with by a player. The default behaviour allows for the block to be labelled by left-clicking it with a sign in hand. If you override this method and want to keep this behaviour, be sure to call super.onInteractBlock()
        Parameters:
        event - the interaction event

      • onSignChange

        public boolean onSignChange(org.bukkit.event.block.SignChangeEvent event)
        Called when a sign attached to an STB block is updated. The default behaviour is to ignore the event.
        Parameters:
        event - the sign change event
        Returns:
        true if the sign should be popped off the block

      • onEntityExplode

        public boolean onEntityExplode(org.bukkit.event.entity.EntityExplodeEvent event)
        Called when this STB block has been hit by an explosion. The default behaviour is to return true; STB blocks will break and drop their item form if hit by an explosion.
        Parameters:
        event - the explosion event
        Returns:
        true if the explosion should cause the block to break, false otherwise

      • getBlockStructure

        public RelativePosition[] getBlockStructure()
        Get a list of extra blocks this STB block has. By default this returns an empty list, but multi-block structures should override this. Each element of the list is a vector containing a relative offset from the item's base location.
        Specified by:
        getBlockStructure in interface STBBlock
        Returns:
        an array of relative offsets for extra blocks in the item

      • tick

        public final void tick()
        This method should not be called directly or overridden; it is automatically called every tick for every block.

      • onServerTick

        public void onServerTick()
        Called every tick for each STB block that is placed in the world, for any STB block where getTickRate() returns a non-zero value. Override this method to define any periodic behaviour of the block.

      • getTickRate

        public int getTickRate()
        Defines the rate at which the block ticks. onServerTick() will be called this frequently. Override this method to have the block tick less frequently. The default rate of 0 means that the block will not tick at all.

      • onChunkLoad

        public void onChunkLoad()
        Called when the chunk that an STB block is in gets loaded.

      • onChunkUnload

        public void onChunkUnload()
        Called when the chunk that an STB block is in gets unloaded.

      • getLocation

        public final org.bukkit.Location getLocation()
        Description copied from interface: STBBlock
        Get the location of the base block of this STB block. This could be null if called on an STB Block object which has not yet been placed in the world (i.e. in item form).
        Specified by:
        getLocation in interface STBBlock
        Returns:
        the base block location

      • setLocation

        public void setLocation(org.bukkit.Location loc)
        Set the location of the base block of this STB block. This should only be called when the block is first placed, or when deserialized.
        Parameters:
        loc - the base block location
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the caller attempts to set a non-null location when the object already has a location set

      • onBlockPlace

        public void onBlockPlace(org.bukkit.event.block.BlockPlaceEvent event)
        Called when an STB block is placed. Subclasses may override this method, but should take care to call the superclass method.
        Parameters:
        event - the block place event

      • onBlockBreak

        public void onBlockBreak(org.bukkit.event.block.BlockBreakEvent event)
        Called when an STB block is actually broken (the event handler runs with MONITOR priority). You must not alter the outcome of this event!

        Subclasses may override this method, but should take care to call the superclass method.

        Parameters:
        event - the block break event

        public final void breakBlock(org.bukkit.block.Block b)

      • updateBlock

        public final void updateBlock(boolean redraw)
        Description copied from interface: STBBlock
        Mark this block as having been modified and thus in need of saving. This should be called whenever a serializable field of a block is modified to ensure that the change is saved.
        Specified by:
        updateBlock in interface STBBlock
        Parameters:
        redraw - if true, also redraw the block in the world

        Overrides:
        toString in class BaseSTBItem

      • getPistonMoveReaction

        public org.bukkit.block.PistonMoveReaction getPistonMoveReaction()
        Description copied from interface: STBBlock
        Check if this STB block can be pushed or pulled by a piston, and if doing so would break it. The default behaviour is to allow movement; override this in subclasses to modify the behaviour.
        Specified by:
        getPistonMoveReaction in interface STBBlock
        Returns:
        the move reaction: one of MOVE, BLOCK, or BREAK
